remarks: Define the class of natural numbers as the smallest inductive set, which is valid provided we assume the Axiom of Infinity.  Definition 6.3 of [Eisenberg] p. 82. _Note_: the natural numbers ` _om ` are a subset of the ordinal numbers ~ df-on .  Later, when we define complex numbers, we will be able to also define a subset of the complex numbers with analogous properties and operations, but they will be different sets.  (Contributed by NM, 6-Aug-1994.)  Use its alias ~ dfom3 instead for naming consistency with set.mm.  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
df-iom $p |- _om = |^| { x | ( (/) e. x /\ A. y e. x suc y e. x ) } $.
$d x y $.
